explains: adj. 无准备的；即席的；尚未准备好的

sentences.en: Our enemies were caught unprepared and we disposed of them without firing a single shot.
sentences.cn: 我们打了它个措手不及，一枪没放就把他们收拾掉了。

sentences.en: Nijay represents a large and growing group of Americans: first-generation college students who enter school unprepared or behind.
sentences.cn: Nijay 代表了一个庞大、且在不断壮大的美国人群体：入学时毫无准备或相对落后的第一代大学生。

sentences.en: She was totally unprepared for his response.
sentences.cn: 她对他的反应毫无准备。
